description:
A mythical creature called a Wumpus is sleeping somewhere in a series of maze-like caves, and your goal is to hunt it down. The cave is dangerous, and in addition to the Wumpus there are bottomless pits and cave bats. Walking into a pit ends the game, encountering a bat will cause you to be relocated to a random location in the cave (which may or may not be safe), and walking into the same room as the Wumpus will cause it to wake up and eat you. To help figure out where these dangers are various cave rooms can provide clues. For example, finding blood splattered in the room means the Wumpus is near, or if you feel a breeze then a pit is near. From these clues you need to deduce the layout of the cave and the location of the Wumpus. If you think you know where the Wumpus is, you have one arrow to fire; a hit wins the game, but a miss means you are eaten by the Wumpus.

Hunt the Wumpus was originally a text based adventure written for mainframes, and this version maintains the same gameplay however graphical enhancements are added. During the game you have a top down view of the cave as you move from room to room with various colors used to indicate the clues. Depending on the difficulty level selected, the map will show you the entire cave that you have visited so far, or only the current room you are standing in. You may also select from several cave difficulty levels (this affects the complexity of the cave layout). When the game ends, you can optionally view the entire cave to see how close (or far) you came to winning.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oops, I fell down a pit!
Aah, I've been eaten by a Wumpus!
Game over, here's the score so far...
Firing my arrow at the Wumpus

title: Hunt the Wumpus

description: TI Invaders is a clone of the game Space Invaders and features similar gameplay. You control a cannon at the bottom of the screen, and need to destroy the rows of bomb-dropping invaders! The invaders march back and forth on the screen; each time the edge of the screen is reached, they drop a row closer towards the bottom. If they reach the bottom of the screen before you destroy them, the game will be over. Destroy all the invaders, and you move on to the next, more difficult level. Occasionally, a flying saucer will appear at the top of the screen; this can be shot for bonus points. Between levels, you will also have an opportunity to earn bonus points by shooting the saucer as many times as possible before it flies off the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shoot the saucer for bonus points!

title: TI Invaders

description: MunchMan is an arcade action game similar to Pac-Man. You control MunchMan who is in a maze; your goal is to lay down a chain throughout each path of the maze (the opposite of Pac-Man where you need to eat all of the dots). Also in the maze are four "Hoonos"; these creatures will be constantly chasing MunchMan, and if he's caught a life is lost. When all of MunchMan's lives are lost, the game is over. To help out, each corner of the maze has a Texas Instruments (TI) logo; eat the TI logo and MunchMan will now temporarily be able to eat the Hoonos for bonus points! When the maze is complete, you move on to the next, more difficult level.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can munch on the Hoonos when they are Black

title: MunchMan

description:
Alpiner is a third-person action game in which the player's goal is to climb safely to the top of various mountains. Each of the six mountains the player climbs has various obstacles which should be avoided: falling rocks, avalanches, wild animals, trees, and brush fires can all hinder progress. Being hit by these obstacles will cause the player to lose progress, falling down part of the mountain (some obstacles cause a short falling distance, others a long distance).

Should the player fall all of the way to the bottom of the mountain a life will be lost. To help anticipate obstacles, voice synthesis provide a warning when danger is near. Each mountain has a time limit in which it must be climbed, though the timer only counts down when the climber isn't moving. As the player progresses through the levels the mountains become higher and obstacles become faster and more numerous.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning to climb up the mountain
Here's the mountains you'll be climbing...
Mountain lions can make climbing more of a challenge...

title: Alpiner

description:
One of the first graphical computer role-playing games, Tunnels of Doom puts the players in control of up to four characters in a single party, to explore the dangerous Tunnels of Doom, fight monsters, and collect treasure. The four characters can be controlled by one player as a party, or by up to four players, each choosing an action during battles.

There are four different character classes available: Fighter, Rogue, Wizard, and Hero. The latter can be selected only if he is the only character in the party. Enemies appear randomly, and the battles are turn-based. Various treasure is scattered around the dungeon; the player also has the option of buying certain equipment. In some places, fountains can be found; drinking from them will affect the party in different ways, positive or negative.
title: Tunnels of Doom

description: Burger Builder is an action platform game similar to BurgerTime. You control a chef, and your goal is to make burgers! The screen consists of various platforms which contain the ingredients you'll need: buns, burgers, and lettuce. When your chef walks over an ingredient, it will fall to the level below. When all the ingredients in a column fall to the bottom of the screen, you'll have a complete hamburger; complete all of the hamburgers on the screen, and you can move on to the next level. Unlike BurgerTime, the ingredients won't cascade downward; there needs to be an open space below for an ingredient to fall into so you'll have to work your way from the bottom of the screen upwards. Of course, there are enemies (in the forms of burgers, pickles, cheese, and mushrooms) that wander about to make your task more difficult! Each platform has an enemy which wanders back and forth; although they can be crushed by falling ingredients (for bonus points), they will appear again and be faster than before! Your only defense against the various opponents is to avoid them.

sample_screenshots.caption: Burgers are formed at the bottom of the screen
Beginning a game; you need to make some burgers!
Climbing a ladder to avoid that speedy mushroom!

title: Burger Builder

description: Junkman Junior is a clone of the game Jumpman Junior. Your goal is to collect all of the junk on the screen so you can earn points and move on to the next level. There are various platforms, ladders, and ropes you will need to climb and jump your way around to reach the various items. From time to time, a bullet will fire at you from off of the screen; be sure to dodge this, otherwise one of your lives will be lost! Although this is primarily an action game, there is a strategy element to it as well, as you may need to figure out an optimal route to reach all of the items. When an item is collected, often there is a consequence on the screen, such as floors disappearing or deadly fires appearing; if you aren't careful, you could find yourself in a difficult situation! Each level has a different theme, and may also feature additional challenges such as moving ladders and falling firestones. There are eleven levels in total to complete.

sample_screenshots.caption: To reach all of the junk you'll need to jump to and from those moving ladders
Leaping over some falling, bouncing firestones...
Avoid the deadly fires on this level
Disappearing and reappearing floors make this level more challenging than it looks

title: Junkman Junior

description:
On the TI, the two parts of the Savage Island series from Scott Adams were combined into one package. This compilation contains:

  • Savage Island Part One
  • Savage Island Part Two
title: Savage Island Series

description:
This compilation, created exclusively for the TI, contains all the remaining Scott Adams adventures after the first dozen (except Fantastic Four), as well as some originals available on the TI only:

  • June Lake
  • Loose
  • Spider-Man
  • Sorcerer of Claymorgue Castle
  • The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the Eighth Dimension
  • The Hulk
title: Adventure Series 13+

description:
Number Magic is an educational game designed to teach young children arithmetic. It is based around a stage magic theme, and includes many images of rabbits and top hats.

Three modes are available. Quick Quiz displays randomly-generated arithmetic questions and the player is scored by correct answers. Comp Quiz allows the user to customize several quiz options, such as enable time limits, choose whether to complete answers or missing numbers, and select custom or randomly-generated questions. Electroflash is similar to Comp Quiz but all of the questions include a specific number and arithmetic operation, chosen by the user.

After each quiz, the player can choose to repeat the same quiz, generate a new quiz with the same options, select a new quiz type, or quit.
title: Number Magic

description:
Parsec is a side-scrolling space shooter. Waves of alien craft swoop down from the top and the player must shoot them down without colliding with them or the ground, running out of fuel, or overheating the ship's laser. Some enemies are harder to destroy and shoot back. At the end of each level, the player must navigate through an asteroid field which can yield many points, but can also result in a loss of ships in the process due to collisions.

The game takes advantage of the TI's speech synthesizer: a female voice occasionally makes comments such as "Nice shooting, pilot!", or "Asteroid field ahead" throughout the course of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Third Wave of Aliens - this time, they come from the left, so they can collide with you easily if you aren't careful

title: Parsec

description:
Aliens called "Morgs" are invading the old west. You must destroy them by shooting them from your "schooner". When you kill them, they turn into cactuses which create obstacles on the map. But if you kill a Morg while it is adjacent to an existing cactus, the Morg and the cactus are both eliminated from the map.

TI released the source code to this game as part of its Editor/Assembler package.
title: Tombstone City: 21st Century

description: As the name implies, A-Maze-Ing is a maze game, but with a twist: you control a mouse who has to make its way through an actual maze. Options include "Cheese Hunt" (collect 10 pieces of cheese in the right order before you are shown the exit), "Escape Maze" (get to the exit as fast as you can), "Mouseholes" (shortcuts through the maze walls) or "Obstacles" (which blocks the center of the passages), whether there are cats (and how many) in the maze, how fast they are, and whether the cats are smart or dumb. Try to beat your own best time, or play with another player choosing between co-operative or competitive play.

sample_screenshots.caption: A simpler maze, but this one has obstacles and cheese to collect
Try to escape from this complex maze

title: A-Maze-Ing

description: Originally called "Alien Attack," this game pits the player against alien "spores." Although the spores themselves are harmless, they can join together to form giant aliens that chase you down and eat you. To make matters more interesting, scattered around the playing field are a number of "incubators," which can hatch either more spores or, at later levels (or in early levels, in more advanced difficulty levels), more aliens. Use your ship's weapons to blast the spores before they can make new aliens, and blast any aliens before they can devour you.
title: The Attack

description: In this combination racing game and maze game, you have to maneuver your race car around the track, clearing the dots from all five lanes. The catch is, there's another car (controlled by the computer) driving around the track, in the opposite direction, bent on stopping you. You have to be quick with the lane changes, or the computer car will crash into you. You start with three cars, and can gain extra cars by clearing all the dots from the track. But watch out! The computer adds an an additional opponent on the third round, and another every second round after that!
title: Car Wars

description: Card games and computers seem to go hand-in-hand. TI's offering, Blackjack & Poker, allows you to play Blackjack or Stud Poker against the computer, or with up to three other players. The Blackjack game has most of the features of real Blackjack, except for the "split" option. The Stud Poker game pits you against three other players (human, computer or both), and follows the rules for 5-Card Stud. Will you break the bank, or lose your shirt? Only Lady Luck knows for sure!
title: Blackjack & Poker

description: Drive your cattle along the famous Chisholm Trail in this top-down arcade-style game from TI. Use the keyboard or joysticks to maneuver your steer around the playing field. But watch out for rustlers who want to steal your cattle, and wranglers who want to put their own brands on your stock. Features 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Chisholm Trail

description:
Try to guess the hidden word, one letter at a time -- if you guess right, nothing happens; if you guess wrong, another piece of the hanged man appears. Too many wrong guesses, and you'll be swinging from the gallows pole!

This version of Hangman was developed by Milton Bradley, originally for their Gamevision line. You can play against the computer, or with a friend. Two different styles of play are available, just to keep things interesting: Regular, which is standard Hangman, or Scramble, in which the letters appear on the screen in the order you guess them, then are unscrambled into the correct word when you win.

In a two-player game, both players can either guess the same word or different words, or they can each enter a word for the other player to solve.

The game also allows a player to create a custom word list, which can be used immediately, or saved to cassette for later use.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can create your own word lists and save them to tape
Better start guessing the right letters, I'm almost out of guesses...

title: Hangman

description:
You're a cowboy fighting off the Slymoids with your gun. They're coming in from the horizon and from the sky. When coming in from they sky they move about from side to side as they slowly descend to the bottom of the play field. You can shoot up in the air at the flying Slymoids, or left and right at the ground dwelling Slymoids once they've reached the front of the screen where you walk to the left or right on the ground.

As you play, the game follows you to the left and right, scrolling through each of the three locations you can play in: along the coast line, in the city, and in the cavern. The cavern has an extra bit as they add strange live dropping stalactites that follow you once they've landed on the ground. Don't get too caught up shooting, you have to stop shooting to move and the Slymoids are coming from all directions but in front of you. You can start the game at any difficulty between 1 and 4, and have three lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Second level, also inside the castle

title: Slymoids

description:
Bouncer is a single-screen action game where the player controls a red ball that uses trampolines to jump between different octagon shaped platforms. On each platform there is a square and to complete a level all white squares have to be collected. The game is a bit similar to Q*bert but instead of a isometric perspective the game uses a slightly tilted top-down view. Instead of enemies jumping around the platforms there are a number of arrows that move horizontally across the screen. Any contact with these leads to a life lost.

The player starts with four lives and an extra one is given upon reaching 3,000 points. Most squares are white but there are also red ones as well as a center dot. White squares are worth ten points while the center dot is initially worth 100 points. However every time the player touches a red square the center dot is reset and its value is increased by 100.

sample_screenshots.caption: When reaching the red square, center dot is reset at a higher value

title: Bouncer

description:
Astromania is an action game that consists of three different sections that have to be played in order.

On the first stage the player will find his space ship stationed in the middle of the screen surrounded by four cannons that launch asteroids towards the player. With the use of four directional keys the player has to shoot down the asteroids before being hit. The second stage is more like a traditional fixed screen shoot 'em up although the player's ship cannot move. Aliens appear in groups of three and move across the screen and the player has to shoot them down before they reach the bottom.

Finally the player has to navigate his ship through a meteor belt. The ship automatically moves upwards and the player has to steer it left and right to avoid the meteors. Upon reaching the top of the screen a droid will appear to the left or right of the ship. The player has to quickly aim and shoot the droid before it destroys the ship. If the player has any lives left after the third stage he will return to the first stage but will play it on a higher difficulty. The player starts the game with ten lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Next stage - this looks more like a shoot 'em up

title: Astromania

description: The object of the game is to pick up patients from their homes and race them to the hospital. When a house flashes, that indicates a sick patient is present. Navigate to the house and press the fire button to pick the patient up. Then, drive through the city to get to the hospital. You have to avoid other cars on the road because they will not stop for you. On certain levels, there's a train that makes you sit and wait. You only have a limited amount of time to deliver your patients.
title: Ambulance

description:
In Bigfoot, your ultimate goal is to scale a mountain and capture the eponymous creature, who stands at the summit. Along the way, you collect food and gold. However, in order to collect one bundle of gold (yellow piles), you must first collect one bundle of food (green boxes). Using the fire button, you throw ropes which are used for climbing up the platforms. Once thrown, you can scale up and down the ropes.

Bigfoot hurls boulders at you as you go. If your rope is near the edge of a platform instead of near the middle, you run the risk of being smashed by a boulder as you climb up the rope, so throwing the rope near the center of a platform is safest. During later levels, birds will come along and snag the ropes - fatal if you happen to be on a snagged rope at the time.
title: Bigfoot

description:
Championship Baseball is one of the few TI games that requires the MBX Expansion System sold by TI and Milton Bradley. It uses voice recognition, the special MBX joysticks (which has three axis and multiple buttons), and the special MBX keypad peripheral to issue plays and instructions to your team. This is a two-player game. There is no one-player option against the computer.

The player at bat uses the joystick to control batting and running, and the fielding player uses voice recognition and the keypad to control the pitcher and fielders. Pitches vary by speed (fast, medium, or slow) and type (fastball or curveball). When fielding, the player speaks the name of the fielder or pitcher to indicate which position should try to catch and throw the ball.
title: Championship Baseball

description: Driving Demon is a racing game played from a top down perspective on a single straight. The player has to race down a two-lane road to earn the high score. Other cars occupy the road and these have to be avoided or else the player will crash and lose a life. Crashes also occur when going off the road and hitting an oil slick. A scanner located to the right of the main view allows the player to spot cars down the road. The game uses manual transmission and it's necessary to shift gears at the appropriate time or else the engine might blow and the player will crash. The game ends when time runs out or after five crashes.
title: Driving Demon

description: This is a two-player simulation of football. It is not an action game, in that you do not directly control the players on the field. Instead, the offense and defense take turns selecting from a menu of plays (dive play, off tackle, hb sweep, fullback draw, screen right, flare pass, slant in, bomb, sideline pass, punt, field goal, and various defensive plays). The computer then simulates the action, based on actual pro football statistics.
title: Football

description: Hen Pecked is a take on the arcade game Joust, but instead of knights, ostriches, and buzzards, you are a rooster trying to rule the roost. Flap your wings with the joystick and try to stay on top of the hens. Landing on them transforms them into eggs, which must be collected before they hatch into a new chicken.
title: Hen Pecked

description:
In Henhouse, you are trying to help a farmer collect his eggs. Eggs are laid in the hen house near the top of the screen, and then move to one of five chutes. When the chute is full, you can collect the eggs and take them to your truck. If the chute is full and another egg lands in it, you'll have a cracked egg. Six cracked eggs will end your game.

Of course, you're not the only one who wants those eggs. Bandits and coyotes appear from time to time. Bandits will steal an egg (earning you a cracked egg), but the coyotes will kill your chickens, ending the game. To stop them, you have to grab your shotgun from the left of the screen and shoot them. There are also two birds flying at the top of the screen. Although they don't harm you, you can shoot them for 50 points.

You must put your gun back when finished defending the hen house, as you cannot collect eggs while holding the gun.
title: Henhouse

description:
Honey Hunt is a simple game where you guide your bee from open flower to flower, collecting nectar and returning it to your hive. Bee assassins, dragonflies, and spider webs are all out to get you. Dragonflies fly around the screen. Bee assassins skip from flower to flower. Spider webs are static, but make navigating nearby very hazardous.

From time to time, a bear wanders by. If the speech synthesizer is attached, you'll hear it say, "Time to get the honey!" You must return to your hive to defend it. Simply being present in the hive is sufficient to ward off the bear.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get some nectar from a flower.....
Don't get caught in the spider's web!

title: Honey Hunt

description:
Hopper is a game similar to the arcade game Pengo. The game is played on single screen levels, each filled with a random assortment of crates, forming a reconfigurable maze.

The player plays the role of Hopper, a kangaroo. Hopper is trying to escape from three circus trainers, who move around the screen trying to capture Hopper.

Hopper can move around in all four directions, and when up against a crate, will push the crates in front of him. The pushed crates slide until they come into contact with another crate, or with the outside walls of the room. This allows Hopper to reconfigure the maze, and to defeat the trainers.

In order to defeat the trainers, Hopper can either push a crate over them (squashing them), or trap them in a single 1x1 space with crates. In order to advance to the next level, all of the trainers must be defeated.

The player has four lives. Each time a trainer captures him, one is lost. The game ends when the four lives are gone.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pushing a box at an enemy

title: Hopper

description:
Astromania is a shoot 'em up where the player has to save a number of planets from a group of invaders called Frizoids. Each planet is divided into two stages. The first one takes place above the planet's surface and is viewed from a side view perspective with some scrolling graphics although the player's movement is limited to moving up and down along the left edge of the screen. To complete a stage numerous enemies have to be shot down and, like the player, they can only move up and down along the edge of the screen. Enemies appear one at a time and when one is killed another takes its place. The gameplay is a bit slower than other shooters due to the player having to hold down the button for a brief moment to fire.

After all aliens above the surface have been eliminated the player has to destroy the aliens' force field generator. The second stage plays similarly to the first one but here the action is viewed from a top down perspective. Instead of moving up and down the player here moves the ship left and right and shoot at the aliens above. Once the generator is destroyed the game moves on to the next planet that needs to be saved. After two planets the player gets to fight the invaders' mother ship which works similarly to the second stage although here it is necessary to hit a specific spot of the ship.
title: Astromania

description: In Jumpy, you control the hero, jumping from platform to platform collecting dots, while trying to avoid monsters and jumping off the edge. Each level features a different layout. You also have the ability to "double jump," skipping over one platform (and, potentially, an enemy) by pressing the Fire button on the joystick.
title: Jumpy

description: In "Rabbit Trail," you control the eponymous character, trying to collect all of the characters before other critters get you. You follow a static trail, using rabbit holes to climb from platform to platform. Jump to evade weasels and snag carrots. Later levels include hawks - and one badly timed jump could land you right in their claws.
title: Rabbit Trail

description:
Guardian is a shoot 'em up where the player (as the titular guardian) has to defend a city's energy pods which an army of robots are trying to steal. There are eight pods in total and they are located in the centre of the screen. The robots appear from all sides and the player has to shoot them down before they are able to get away with the pods. The player can move in four directions and a single shot is enough to destroy a robot. If a robot picks up a pod and then is shot it will drop the pod on the spot. A level is completed once all robots have been destroyed and pods will return to their original positions in the next level. Pods that have been stolen will not reappear and the game goes on until all pods have been lost.

The game features a two player mode that is both cooperative and competitive at the same. Like in the single player mode the two players have to defend the pods from the robot attacks but they can also kill each other to get extra points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Robots that look like long legged frogs

title: Guardian

description: The Wall is a single screen action game where the player simply has to climb a castle wall from the bottom to the top. Upon reaching the top the game automatically advanced to the next wall. The player can climb in any direction but has to watch out for various objects that move around the screen. For each new level there is a different one that has its own movement pattern. Some fall from the top while others appear from the sides. Any contact with them will cause the player to fall down and one life will be lost but a bonus life is given after every 500 points.
title: The Wall

description: Robopods is a single screen game where the earth has been invaded by alien robopods. The player's task is to deactivate the robopods by climbing up between their legs. The robopods are numbered and have to be deactivated in the correct order or else they will explode and the game will end. The player can move around in any direction but the character leaves behind radioactive footprints which the player cannot step on, although occasionally safety mats appear across the track. In addition to the robopods, there are a number of alien land mines on the screen that have to be avoided. Stepping on a mine or the footprints or taking too long of a time will also lead to a game over. There are five skill levels that differ on the number of robopods and mines.

sample_screenshots.caption: Safety maps appear after a while

title: Robopods

description:
Barrage is a variant of Missile Command where the player has to prevent the fiendish Draks from dropping acid balls on a planet. The player is in command of two laser gun towers located at the side of the screen and moves a crosshair to aim and destroy the small balls as they appear from the top of the screen. On the ground are various military vehicles and buildings that have to be protected.

Each attack consists of a number of waves that gets increasingly larger and faster. Starting from the second attack acid balls that can change their course will appear and from the third the fast moving hydrazine meteors will appear. The two guns have limited ammo so it is necessary to shoot sparingly. At the start of a new attack the guns are rebuilt and restocked.

In addition to the single player mode there are both cooperative and competitive two player modes.

sample_screenshots.caption: The large pink balls can change direction
Blasting away at the acid balls

title: Barrage

description: Black Box is a licensed computer adaptation of the board game with the same name. It is played on a 8 by 8 grid where a number of atoms are hidden. The number of atoms can be selected before starting with a maximum of ten. To locate the atoms the player has to send rays from the sides of the grid and see if the they are absorbed, reflected or deflected by the atoms. Rays that directly hit the atoms are absorbed while rays that move one box away from an atom are reflected. The rays' path through the grid is not shown so the player has to figure it out based on where they exit the grid. When the player thinks he knows the atoms' positions he can make guesses and will then get a score depending on how many were right.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sending a ray that goes all the way through
Trying to guess, but getting them all wrong
Here we can see one ray is absorbed and another one is reflected

title: Black Box

description: Mr. Frog is a collection of three simple educational games for children ages 2-7: Letter Hop, Rock Hop and Frog Race. In Letter Hop there are five rocks with letters and the player has to press the space bar to move the frog to the rock with the same letter as the one displayed at the top of the screen. For every correct answer another frog will make a hop forward and the game is complete when it has done five hops. Rock Hop shows four lily pads and one rock and the player has to enter the number of hops that are needed to reach the rock. Frog Race can be played by two players and shows a letter at the top of the screen. The first player to type the letter makes one hop forward and the aim is to reach the rock at the left edge of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Letter Hop: Hopping towards the V
Letter Hop: The frog below jumps forward for each correct answer

title: Mr. Frog

description:
Beneath the Stars is a fixed screen shoot 'em up where the player is the commander of a space base that has to protected as it is being attacked by aliens. A large generator is located at the bottom of the screen and above it is a force field that offers protection. The aliens appear from the top and will attempt to blast holes into the force field before crashing into the generator.

The player is in control of two different vehicles, a space lazer and a repair craft, that can be moved left and right over the force field. The space lazer is used to shoot down the aliens while the repair craft is used to repair holes in the force field. While the repair craft can move over holes the lazer will fall down and destroy the generator if it attempts to do so. The lazer does however have a thrust that allow it to fly over holes. Additionally there are two stationary weapons located at the sides of the screen: missiles and a neutron gun. The game ends if the aliens hit the generator more than once.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to shoot down an alien
The lazer falling down onto the generator...

title: Beneath the Stars

alternate_titles.title: Munchman II: The Monster is Back!

description:
Munchman II is a sequel to the original Munchman, Texas Instruments' own variant of Pac-Man. While the first game had the munchman laying down a chain throughout the maze, this game is more like a traditional Pac-Man game with the player having to eat all the chains. There are four enemies called hoonos attempting to kill the munchman but by eating an energizer it can for a short while go after and kill them.

Some new features set the game apart from other Pac-Man games. The maze is made up of two interconnected screens that the player can move between through two doors. To complete a level the chains of both screens have to be eaten. Another feature is the teleporter that roam around the maze. By running into it the munchman is transported to the other screen.

There are two modes of play: arcade and tournament. In the arcade mode the player has three lives and earns an extra one after every 10,000 points scored. In the tournament mode there is only one life and no extra ones can be earned.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting teleported to the second screen

title: Munchman II

description: Mean Streets is a fixed screen shoot 'em up where the player is in control of a SWAT team whose task it is to shoot down terrorists who have robbed a bank. The game uses pseudo three dimensional graphics to depict streets and buildings. The player controls his officer left and right along a street from a behind view and shoots at the enemies that appear on the side streets. The enemies appear one or two at a time and a single shot is enough to kill them. They do not always die right away and while they are wounded they can still shoot back and kill the player. After being killed an ambulance appears and takes the officer away and another one steps out of the SWAT van to take his place. The player has access to ten officers in total. In addition to the enemy fire there are also bombs being dropped from buildings that can kill the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: The SWAT truck enters the scene
Warning for falling bombs (the tiny red dot)
Another SWAT man appears from the truck

title: Mean Streets

description:
Carfax Abbey is a game where the player gets to explore the home of Count Dracula from a first person perspective. The abbey has four floors with twenty five rooms on each and the player moves between rooms through doors, secret passages, lifts and stairs. The objective of the game is to find and destroy Dracula and to do so a hidden crucifix must be found and it is also necessary to gain a magic rating of at least 200. The magic rating increases by finding various items such as potions, goblets and wands. The player also has an energy rating which is 100% when starting out and increases with ten points for each room visited. Subsequent visits to the same room will however lead to a loss of five points. If the energy level reaches zero the game will end.

There are several different creatures that live in the abbey. They include goblins, blobs, ghosts, imps and skeletons. Some of these are hostile and will take away some energy or magic. Others are friendly such as the goblins who are traders that will sell energy or magic in exchange for gold. To be able to open locked doors it is necessary to find a skeleton key. It will however reduce 25 energy points for each door. The same amount will be lost when moving through secret passages.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gaining points for entering a room

title: Carfax Abbey

description:
007: Aqua Base is a text adventure and the first game in the TIventures series. As can be expected it is inspired by James Bond books and movies with the player taking the role of the secret agent. An evil computer operator is planning to blow up the world and the player's task is to find his hidden aqua base, backfire his lasers and then escape before everything blows up. It all has to be done within 90 minutes.

The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world. The game has a built-in hint system which is accessed by typing "help".

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to exit the sub while in water

title: 007: Aqua Base

description: Who's Behind the Mexican UFOs is an adventure game where the player is in control of an American secret agent whose task it is to investigate the appearances of strange sombrero shaped UFOs in different parts of the world. The sightings are connected with organized crime and after some important military documents are stolen the player is sent out to retrieve them. The game starts out in Paris but similar to Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? the player gets to travel to numerous locations all around the world in an attempt to find the criminals. The gameplay is similar to a visual novel with the player being presented with text that explains what is going on and then at times gets to choose what should happen next.
title: Who's Behind the Mexican UFOs

description: Laser Shield is a Missile Command variant that is played with a completely different control method. Rather than using a crosshair to aim with, this game uses a coordinate based system using the keyboard. To fire the lasers the player enters the altitude (1 to 9) and the area (A to E) followed by pressing the fire button. There are four cities that need to be defended and between them is the laser base that also needs to survive the attack. The missiles will appear in three waves that get increasingly harder. Points are awarded based on how many cities survive each wave. The game ends when all cities or the laser base have been destroyed.
title: Laser Shield

description: 99'Vaders is a variant of Astro Invader, an arcade shoot 'em up where aliens are released from a mothership and positioned in columns before attacking. When one column is full the aliens will start descending, one at a time, and explode upon reaching the bottom of the screen. If the player's ship is within the blast radius it will be destroyed and one of three lives are lost. In addition to the regular aliens, there are also deadly vessels which fall from the ship's side chutes and will kill the player no matter the position. When a certain amount of aliens have been killed the mothership takes off and another harder one will take its place. As it leaves it is possible to shoot its exhaust tube for extra points.

sample_screenshots.caption: The background colour changes every playthrough

title: 99'Vaders

description: The Secret Agent is a platform game with two single screen stages with different gameplay. The first one takes place on a moving train and the agent has to make his way across it to a briefcase that is located at the far end. To get there it is necessary to jump over pylons and between the carriages without falling down. Once one briefcase has been collected another one appears on the opposite end and to complete the stage six briefcases have to be retrieved. For each run across the train the number of pylons increases. The second stage involve jumping up and down between cable cars. Once again the objective is to retrieve a briefcase. Once completed the game returns to the first stage but at a faster pace.
title: The Secret Agent

description: In Pulsar the player's task is to mine terellium ore from solar systems whose stars are about to go supernova. In each level the player controls a robot mining vessels around a star in an attempt to collect as many ore rocks as possible. When the star is close to exploding a mothership will appear and the player has to attempt docking with it before it leaves. If not the player will ultimately be destroyed in the explosion and lose one life. Other things to look out for are the gamma rays that are emitted from the star. If hit by these the value of the ore is reduced. There are also comets that one should avoid crashing into and space pirates that use tractor beams to steel the player's ore. If the vessel is hit by the beam when out of ore it will be destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Failing to dock leads to getting caught in explosion
Caught by space pirates' tractor beam

title: Pulsar

description: Fly Snuffer is an action game where the player has to exterminate a large number of flies with an aerosol spray. The game is played on a single screen where the flies buzz around and the player has to shoot them with the can. But there are also other insects invading the screen. Cockroaches run along the floor and needs to be smashed with the can while bees are killed in the same way as the flies but their lethal sting has to be avoided. Each level is completed when ten flies have been killed and it has to be done within a time limit. The amount of spray is also limited but it is recharged after every 1000 points scored.

sample_screenshots.caption: A cockroach runs across the floor

title: Fly Snuffer

description: Newton's Revenge is a variant of Atari's arcade game Avalanche. The objective is to catch apples that are falling from a tree. It is done by moving three baskets left and right across the screen. Every time an apple hits the ground one of the baskets is removed and when they are all gone the game is over. Additional baskets are given when reaching certain scores. The game has four difficulty levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Additional baskets are given when scoring well
The game gets harder with only one basket left
Trying to catch the falling apples

title: Newton's Revenge

description: Blackbeard's Treasure is a single screen action game where the player has to retrieve the lost treasure of Blackbeard the pirate. The treasure is located at the bottom of the sea and to collect it divers have to be sent down. The divers have to be guided from the boat at the top of the screen to the treasure at the bottom and then back up again. The problem is that the water is full of sharks and two giant octopuses are guarding the treasure. Any contact with these and one of the five divers is lost. Up to three treasures can be carried at a time and after ten have been retrieved the level increases. After twenty treasures an extra diver is given.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting an extra diver after 20 treasures
Grabbing some treasure on the sea floor
Trying to avoid being eaten by a shark

title: Blackbeard's Treasure

description: Fun House is a text adventure that is part of the TIventures series. The game has a premise similar to Scott Adams' Mystery Fun House with the player exploring a mysterious fun house. The player has to face various challenges including a room of mirrors before ultimately escaping the house. The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world.
title: Fun House

description: Miner 49'er is a text adventure that is part of the TIventures series. It is set in a ghost town that was once a prosperous mining town. Rumours of a monster in the mine scared the people away and they left their treasures behind. The objective of the game is to enter the mine and find three treasures without being killed by the monster. The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to take a gun from the jail
A bear is blocking the entrance to the mine

title: Miner 49'er

description: Stone Age is a text adventure that is part of the TIventures series. Despite its title (and the manual mentioning the year 5000 B.C.) the game actually takes place in the time of dinosaurs. The objective of the game is to survive the dangers and find a time machine and travel back to the 20th century. The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using log to float on the stream

title: Stone Age

description: Haunted House is a text adventure that is part of the TIventures series. This game has a horror theme and takes place in a house full of monsters and magic. The objective is to find a hidden ruby and then escape the house with it. The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to take a book from a wizard

title: Haunted House

description: In Search of: The Four Vedas is a text adventure that is part of the TIventures series. The game tells the story of a tribe who sends an expedition to retrieve the ancient books that were lost many years ago. The party never returned and now it's the player's task to find and take back the books that are said to contain knowledge of the past and of magic. The game works like any text adventure with the player entering compass directions to move around while simple two word verb noun commands such as "take card" are used to interact with the world.

sample_screenshots.caption: Climbing a tree only to find an albotross (sic)

title: In Search of: The Four Vedas

description: Barnyard Fun is a memory game for children. The screen will show eight barns and the objective is to find the animals that are hidden in each barn. The game is similar to Concentration but here an animal is shown on the screen and the player only has to pick one barn with a matching animal. The aim is to find five animals and to do so with the least amount of tries. The game has three difficulty levels: beginner, intermediate and advanced. The intermediate level is the same as the beginner level but a found animal is subtracted with every wrong guess. The advanced level is the same as the intermediate level but each animal exists in two different colours that have to be matched.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pressing a number reveals an animal
Found animals appear at the bottom

title: Barnyard Fun

description:
Moon Mine is a shoot' em up where the player is the captain of the U.S.S. Recovery and has to capture treasure that has been stolen from Earth. The culprit is the evil Zygonaut who has hidden the treasures in a mine shaft in the centre of the moon. As the player descends down the mine shaft ten different creatures will appear that have to be destroyed. This is done with four lasers, one on each side of the screen. The creatures appear far down the shaft and move towards the player's guns. More points are earned by shooting them at a far distance.

Firing the lasers too much will lead to them overheating. They are cooled with water and at times it is necessary to replenish the water supply. Pools of water occasionally appear on the screen and the player then has to send out a crew member to retrieve it. The crew member can destroy monsters with a hand laser but it only has twelve shots. At times treasure (silver, jade and amethyst) will appear and it is collected in the same way.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sending out a crew member to retrieve object
The creatures come in many different shapes and colours

title: Moon Mine

description: Rock Runner is a Boulder Dash variant. The game contains fifteen levels where the player has to dig tunnels through earth and collect all the diamonds before time runs out. While doing so it is necessary to watch out for boulders which can fall down and crush the player. There are also some enemies that can kill the player upon contact. They can be destroyed by falling boulders or by placing a bomb next to them and will then turned into diamonds. Other obstacles include walls and expanding acid pools. Once all diamonds have been collected the player can move on to the next level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Placing a bomb, now run away

title: Rock Runner

description: Touch Typing Tutor challenges its players by air-dropping words across the screen as a green airplane passes by through the sky. As the words are released from the plane, the user must quickly finish typing the word before the plane passes back by to release a new word in its place. As you complete words, they will morph into small explosions in the sky. Complete as many words as you can to rack up points. Players can compete for the high score.
title: Touch Typing Tutor

description: Numeration 2 is an arithmetic educational title for young children. The game presents kids with sets of 10 problems/activities such as counting, comparing and rounding numbers, depicted as games at a carnival. Prior to taking up an activity, you have the option to watch a short briefing on the principle currently at hand. After ten questions answered, you are evaluated and can take up the same type of challenge or a new one. The game adjusts itself according to the players performance to better mach each individual's skill. Like many TI-99 educational titles, Numeration 2 makes use of the optional speech synthesizer made by TI to enrich the experience.

sample_screenshots.caption: Round to tens. Can we calculate the weight of these bananas?

title: Numeration 2: At The Carnival

description:
Yahtzee is a computer implementation of the dice game. It can be played with one player against the computer, or two players against each other. Players take turns rolling the dice and trying to get various combinations. In a turn the dice (or subset of dice) can be re-rolled twice. Once the players filled their scorecards whoever earned the most points wins the game.

The game features a challenge mode in which the first roll is always the same for both players.
title: Yahtzee

description: Zero Zap is a trick shooting game. The game can be played with one or two players and has preconfigured levels or players can build their own. The player fires projectiles from the bottom of the screen and can score points by hitting numbered targets. A shot ends when it returns back to baseline or when hitting a target with value 0. Shots are deflected ninety degrees by deflectors and 180 degrees by walls. The walls themselves are pushed back when hit. Players have limited shots and must try to earn as many points as possible.
title: Zero Zap

description:
Video Chess is a chess game played against the computer. The game features three levels of play (beginner, novice, and intermediate). For the intermediate level a maximum thinking time can be selected from 30 to 200 seconds for the computer to come up with a move. The computer can be made to play with a style (normal, aggressive, or defensive). In the beginner mode it can also play an additional losing style.

Aside from playing a full game of chess the game also offers various chess problems (mate in two or three).

The game features the ability to record matches to rewatch later. It's also possible to play up to nine games simultaneously against the computer.
title: Video Chess

description:
Connect Four is a computer implementation of the board game of the same name. Players take turns placing tokens in a column on the screen. Tokens always drop to the bottom most available spot of a column. The goal is to get four tokens of the same color in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally). The first to do so wins the game. The game can be played against another player or the computer.

Two other game modes are included. In Drop Out allows you to remove a token from the bottom row instead of inserting a new token. Wild Spot has one double color token in the playing field from the start at a random location. Both players can use it to get four in a row.
title: Connect Four

description: Random Note Guessing Game is a simple guessing game. The player is presented with a tone and must guess the frequency of the tone.
title: Random Note Guessing Game

description: Early Learning Fun is an educational title for young children aged 3 through 6. It features a number of activities with numbers, shapes, sorting and the alphabet. There are eight activities in total. All are displayed with color graphics and sound effects. Each activity starts with instructions for the parent.
title: Early Learning Fun

description: Early Reading is an educational title with multiple activities aimed at learning how to read. Skills that are taught are learning to find a specific word in a sentence, linking a word with an image, and choose-your-own-adventure style story creation. The game uses the TI-99/4's speech synthesizer to speak out words and sentences. Color pictures show graphical depictions of all the words that are taught. The game is aimed at children aged 3 to 7.
title: Early Reading
